title.rendered: About More Than Warmth: Why Home Insulation is an Essential Service For Your Home

content.rendered:
A lot of homeowners think that home insulation Allentown, PA, is only about adding an extra layer of protection against the cold weather. But that’s not entirely true.

Insulating your home can also help you reduce your energy consumption, significantly lowering your electricity bills. In fact, one of the most effective ways to save energy is by insulating your entire home as it will keep it cool in the summer and warm in the winter.

According to the Environmental Protection Agency, you can save 15% on cooling and heating costs by adding insulation in your basement, crawl space, and attic.

This post will help you understand why insulation installation, Allentown, PA, is so important and how you can use it to make your home more energy efficient.

What is Home Insulation, Allentown, PA?

Insulation is material used to reduce heat gain or heat loss by providing a barrier between your home interior and the outside temperature. It helps you keep the desired temperature in your home throughout the year and protects it against excess heat in summer and cold in winter.

Another lesser-known but incredible benefit of insulation installation Allentown, PA, is it reduces noise pollution. So, if you have a particularly noisy neighbor or a teenager who loves listening to loud music, insulation will help cancel out that noise significantly. 

If you are wondering how much money you can save on energy bills by adding insulation, it will depend on a lot of factors like the size of your house and the type of insulation you choose.

Most modern houses are built with insulation but if your house is older, it’s likely without insulation. You can choose to insulate your doors, windows, walls, floors, attic, basement, and crawlspace. The most important thing you need to insulate is your walls since house walls lose around 30-40% of the heat during winters.

What Type Of Insulation Installation, Allentown, PA is Best?

There are different qualities and materials, but all good insulators are made up of a substance that’s very much like wool. Fabrics like hemp and cotton are excellent insulators, and wood-based materials are also a good choice.

You can also go for spray foam or fiberglass insulation, which are a bit expensive but well worth their cost.

We recommend contacting an insulation expert to check out your house and determine which material will suit you best, based on your budget and the weather you live in.

Save Money on Your Next Energy Bill with Home Insulation

By insulating your home, you’ll reduce your energy consumption and lower the amount of polluting gases that are emitted into the environment to produce that energy. In this way, you will be doing your part in cutting down your carbon footprint and protecting the atmosphere.

If you are ready to make your home more energy efficient and save a ton of money in the process, schedule a free consultation for home insulation, Allentown, PA, with United Home Services.

We will also be following CDC’s strict COVID-19 guidelines while assessing your home and installing the insulation.
